previousScannedThrough: Feed check Feb 3 — no new 2026 eps (last: Dec 30, 2025). 128 total eps. Karpathy ep still pending deep-scan.
newScannedThrough: Scanned through Feb 15, 2026. 3 new episodes in Feb 2026: Dario Amodei (Feb 13), Elon Musk (Feb 5), Adam Marblestone (Feb 5). Plus Jan 10 blog post. ~131 total eps.

newContent.title: Dario Amodei — 'We are near the end of the exponential'
newContent.notes: Anthropic CEO discusses: engineers who don't write code anymore (AI does it), Claude Code accelerating internal dev, organizational structure for scaling compute, multiple business models coexisting. Revenue trajectory: $0→$100M (2023), $1B (2024), $9-10B (2025), added several billion in Jan 2026 alone.

newContent.title: Elon Musk — 'In 36 months, the cheapest place to put AI will be space'
newContent.notes: xAI organizational structure: prefers 'engineer' over 'researcher', several hundred people on AI interpretability/debuggers. Humanoid manufacturing: building entirely custom supply chain from first principles, 'Optimus Academy' for robot training. Bold prediction: 'pure AI corporations will far outperform any corporations that have humans in the loop.' Grok as orchestration layer for Optimus robots.

newContent.title: Adam Marblestone — 'AI is missing something fundamental about the brain'
newContent.notes: Neuroscience focus. May have organizational implications but needs deep-scan.

newContent.title: What I've been reading recently - Jan 10, 2026
newContent.notes: Blog post, not podcast episode. Reading notes on neuroscience topics.

summary: Significant new content since Feb 3 scan. Two HIGH-relevance episodes: (1) Dario Amodei interview with rich organizational findings on Anthropic's internal AI adoption — engineers no longer writing code, Claude Code accelerating development, scaling decisions; (2) Elon Musk interview covering xAI's engineering-focused culture, humanoid manufacturing organization (custom supply chain, Optimus Academy), and provocative claim that pure-AI corporations will outperform human-in-loop organizations. Both warrant specimen enrichment or new specimens.

curateRecommendations.rationale: Dario interview provides fresh data on Anthropic's internal AI adoption and organizational structure. Engineers not writing code, Claude Code integration, scaling decisions.
keyFindings: Engineers at Anthropic who don't write any code — AI handles it
Claude Code used internally for GPU kernels, chip design
Deliberate compute allocation strategy prioritizing sustainability over max scaling

curateRecommendations.rationale: Elon interview reveals xAI organizational structure, alignment approach, Grok-Optimus integration vision.
keyFindings: Several hundred people on AI interpretability/debuggers
Mission-based alignment vs traditional safety governance
Prediction: pure-AI corporations will outperform human-in-loop orgs

curateRecommendations.rationale: Humanoid manufacturing organization details: custom supply chain, Optimus Academy training infrastructure.
keyFindings: Building entirely custom actuators, motors, gears — no existing supply chain
Optimus Academy: tens of thousands of robots for self-play training
S-curve production: Optimus 3 targets 1M units/year, Optimus 4 targets 10M
